Initialize Census Database

Source: R/db_operations.R
init_census_data.Rd

Creates or initializes the census database with both 2010 and 2020 census data. Data is fetched from the Census API.

Usage

init_census_data(
  worker_threads = parallel::detectCores() - 1,
  memory_limit = "4GB",
  include_pop_estimates = FALSE,
  pop_estimate_years = c(2021, 2022, 2023)
)

Arguments

worker_threads

Integer. Number of threads for parallel processing when fetching from API.

memory_limit

Character. Memory limit for DuckDB (default: "4GB").

include_pop_estimates

Logical. Whether to include population estimates data. Default is FALSE.

pop_estimate_years

Numeric vector. Years to include for population estimates. Default is c(2021, 2022, 2023).

Value

None. Creates or initializes the census database.

Details

The function fetches data from the Census API and processes it into a DuckDB database.

  • Census data for 2010 and 2020 is always fetched

  • Population estimates can be optionally included

  • If the database already exists, it will check for existing tables and only add missing ones

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Initialize with just census data
init_census_data()

# Initialize with census data and population estimates
init_census_data(include_pop_estimates = TRUE)

# Customize API fetch settings
init_census_data(
  worker_threads = 4,
  memory_limit = "8GB"
)
} # }
